importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the current stage of the postseason in the 2025 MLB season.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the 2025 World Series, marking the beginning of the championship series between the Toronto Blue Jays and the Los Angeles Dodgers.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from July 2025 to October 2025 marks the key timeline of the Blue Jays' turnaround and their progression through the playoffs, culminating in their ALCS victory.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series for the first time since 1993, following a dramatic seven-game ALCS victory over the Seattle Mariners.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll and a record of two World Series titles in the past nine seasons, are the formidable opponent in the World Series.
The Dodgers' postseason run was dominant, including a Game 4 NLCS-clinching performance by Shohei Ohtani, who achieved three home runs and a 6.1-innings shutout with 10 strikeouts.
The Blue Jays' success in the ALCS, including a 34-run offensive output against the Yankees in the ALDS, highlights their transition from last place in 2024 to a top team in 2025.
The Dodgers' bullpen has been a weakness throughout the season, creating a potential vulnerability the Blue Jays could exploit in the World Series.
Game 1 of the World Series is set for Friday, October 24, in Toronto, marking the start of a historic matchup between two top-tier teams.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the team that has just advanced to the World Series after defeating the Seattle Mariners in seven games in the ALCS, marking their first appearance since 1993.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the current opponents in the World Series, having won multiple postseason series and possessing a strong, high-payroll roster, including the two-time World Series champion Shohei Ohtani.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, known for excelling as both a hitter and pitcher.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a legendary performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, hitting three home runs and pitching 6.1 shutout innings with 10 strikeouts, a performance widely regarded as one of the greatest individual games in MLB history.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the Blue Jays' opponent in the ALCS and were eliminated in Game 7 after a series of late-game collapses, including three errors in Game 6 and a late home run by George Springer in Game 7.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A key player for the Toronto Blue Jays, known for his powerful hitting.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer hit a late three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS against the Mariners, effectively ending their hopes and sealing the Blue Jays' advancement to the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays, who participated in Game 7 of the ALCS.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman expressed confidence in the team's ability to stay competitive throughout the ALCS, stating that 'it was never a doubt that one of these guys was going to come through.'

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLDS, highlighting the Dodgers' dominance in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the NLCS, indicating the Dodgers' strength and depth in postseason play.

namedEntities.name: New York Yankees
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in New York, New York.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees were the division rivals of the Blue Jays in the ALDS, where Toronto's bats overwhelmed them with 34 runs across four games.

namedEntities.name: Pittsburgh Pirates
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Pirates defeated the Dodgers in a September sweep during the regular season, highlighting some inconsistencies in the Dodgers' late-game performance.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series for the first time since 1993 after defeating the Seattle Mariners in a hard-fought seven-game ALCS, with George Springer's late home run sealing the series. The Blue Jays, who transformed from last place in 2024 to a top team in 2025, will face the Los Angeles Dodgers, baseball's most successful franchise in recent years with two World Series titles and a dominant postseason run. The Dodgers, led by two-way superstar Shohei Ohtani, have also advanced through the postseason with a sweep of the Milwaukee Brewers and a decisive win over the Philadelphia Phillies. While the Dodgers boast a strong overall team, including elite starting pitchers and a powerful offense, their bullpen has been a weakness. The Blue Jays may exploit this vulnerability, especially as Game 1 of the World Series is set for Friday, October 24, in Toronto.
title: Dodgers and Blue Jays Set for World Series Clash in 2025
